issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
a) Download and install windows image
b) Run windows image using a keypair
c) Get windows password e.g {{euca-get-password -k sshlogin i-7ea81aaa}}
d) Login to the windows instance using MS RDP (username: {{Administrator}})

The instance is accessible via RDP client, but login fails due to incorrect username/password. Tested with both VPCMIDO and EDGE mode.

Tried the same instance with a 4.3 cloud (EDGE), works as expected.
fields.summary: Windows instance login fails due to incorrect username/password

comments.body: The issue was the version of qemu-kvm that causes corrupt files in windows guest's floppy. [~dmitrii] looking into packaging to solve the problem.

[~dmitrii], [~spark]: I did build those qemu-*-2.6.0-27.1 packages from source and place them on our yum repo.  If there is a theory that they are causing this problem, we could try replacing what is installed from internal yum repos, with the stock RPM from here:

https://cbs.centos.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=539

Now that I look at the package info above, it shows a newer qemu-kvm-ev than what I have on our internal repo, version qemu-kvm-ev-2.6.0-28, maybe we should try that package too for giggles.

Thanks, [~mbacchi], let's try that package. [~tony] is firing off a new Windows test.

Just for posterity, the corruption problem that [~spark] and I saw is as follows: The floppy was attached to the guest and top-level directory structure appeared correct. There were two files and a directory named 'boot' on it. File sizes were correct, but the files had zeros in them. Looking inside the 'boot' directory, however, file names there had garbage characters in them. I was able to create a new file at the top level and the data I put into it was readable in the guest. However, when I mounted the floppy image on the host, the new file had the right size, but was full of zeros.

I tried the latest qemu (2.6.0-28 from https://cbs.centos.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=539) and had the same issue logging in.

To install the different version I did this:
{code}
[root@a-39 ~]# yum install http://cbs.centos.org/kojifiles/packages/qemu-kvm-ev/2.6.0/28.el7_3.3.1/x86_64/qemu-kvm-ev-2.6.0-28.el7_3.3.1.x86_64.rpm http://cbs.centos.org/kojifiles/packages/qemu-kvm-ev/2.6.0/28.el7_3.3.1/x86_64/qemu-img-ev-2.6.0-28.el7_3.3.1.x86_64.rpm http://cbs.centos.org/kojifiles/packages/qemu-kvm-ev/2.6.0/28.el7_3.3.1/x86_64/qemu-kvm-common-ev-2.6.0-28.el7_3.3.1.x86_64.rpm
{code}

resulting in:
{code}
[root@a-39 ~]# yum info qemu-kvm-ev
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror, langpacks
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * extras: mirror.supremebytes.com
Installed Packages
Name        : qemu-kvm-ev
Arch        : x86_64
Epoch       : 10
Version     : 2.6.0
Release     : 28.el7_3.3.1
{code}

I then started a windows VM, retrieved password with euca-get-password and attempted RDP login. Login failed with invalid user password combo error.

I tried building qemu-2.8 source from http://www.qemu-project.org/download/#source, but it installs into totally different locations than the qemu-kvm-ev package.  For example files that are typically in /usr/share/qemu-kvm are instead in /usr/share/qemu

I will attempt running qemu outside of Eucalyptus next to see if the qemu-kvm-2.6 RPM works on its own with windows floppies, and also whether qemu-2.8 source does as well, and report back here.

Trying out the new floppy.new from [~dmitrii], I get odd results.  Viewing the contents of the floppy from the VM, I can see the files that were in the image originally listed, but not read the contents, it looks like all blank lines.  If I create a file while on the VM using Windows Powershell, I can view the contents of that file after creation, on the VM itself.  But if I mount the floppy device on the host OS, and try to see the contents of the newly created file (even after stopping the guest VM, i.e. after flushing the file descriptors), I cannot see what was written in the file.  But on the host OS, I can see the contents of the configuration.xml and credentials files.
Thanks for checking out the new floppy image, [~mbacchi]. Your experience matches mine exactly with the old image and a Euca Windows VM.

[~dmitrii] I was able to build a cloud with the 1.44 MB floppy device formatted as vfat, containing only the credential and configuration.xml files.  This is in my branch dev-mbacchi-EUCA-13247 FYI.  The cloud is here: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/504/

I was able to run a windows instance, described here:


{code:java}
[root@e-11 ~]# euca-describe-instances | grep i-ddd2826d
INSTANCE	i-ddd2826d	emi-fa28d739	euca-10-111-76-41.eucalyptus.g-05-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-111-76-95.eucalyptus.internal	running	bacchi	0		m2.2xlarge	2017-02-28T14:51:41.715Z	one			windows	monitoring-disabled	10.111.76.41	10.111.76.95			instance-store	hvm			sg-015e1a48				x86_64
TAG	instance	i-ddd2826d	euca:node	10.111.1.177
[root@e-11 ~]# euca-get-password -k bacchi.key i-ddd2826d
kz7kmshM
{code}

The floppy is available and I can read the contents of the files:


{code:java}
PS A:\> dir


    Directory: A:\


Mode                LastWriteTime     Length Name
----                -------------     ------ ----
-a---         2/27/2017  11:21 PM       9399 credential
-a---         2/28/2017   5:56 AM        292 configuration.xml
-a---         2/28/2017   5:57 AM         37 instinfo.xml


PS A:\> cat .\configuration.xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<Configuration xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" versi
on="0.1" xmlns="http://eucalyptus.com">
  <Hostname>i-ddd2826d</Hostname>
  <LocalAccount />
  <ActiveDirectory xsi:nil="true" />
</Configuration>
PS A:\> type .\instinfo.xml
<IPADDRESS>10.111.76.95</IPADDRESS>
PS A:\>
PS A:\>
{code}

[~mbacchi], nice work! This looks promising. I think the next steps are:

1) add the change to libvirt.xsl that tells boot-loader to try HD first (so we don't stumble on an unbootable floppy)

{code}
--- a/tools/libvirt.xsl
+++ b/tools/libvirt.xsl
@@ -139,6 +139,7 @@ that describes a Eucalyptus instance to be launched.
                         <xsl:message terminate="yes">ERROR: invalid or unset /instance/os/@platform or /instance/backing/root/@ty
                     </xsl:otherwise>
                 </xsl:choose>
+               <boot dev='hd'/>
             </os>
             <features>
                 <acpi/>
{code}

2) do full Windows test

3) test the imaging service (which also relies on floppies)

Testing is coming along well, I built a cloud against my branch, ran it through the nephoria windows tests which succeeded, and performed this manual test to verify that I could read the floppy contents on an instance and via mounting the floppy device locally on the NC.

From the instance:

{code:java}
Windows PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2012 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS C:\Users\Administrator> a:
PS A:\> dir


    Directory: A:\


Mode                LastWriteTime     Length Name
----                -------------     ------ ----
-a---         2/27/2017  11:21 PM       9399 credential
-a---          3/1/2017  11:21 AM        292 configuration.xml
-a---          3/1/2017  11:21 AM         37 instinfo.xml


PS A:\> cat .\configuration.xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<Configuration xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" versi
on="0.1" xmlns="http://eucalyptus.com">
  <Hostname>i-e368a863</Hostname>
  <LocalAccount />
  <ActiveDirectory xsi:nil="true" />
</Configuration>
PS A:\> cat .\credential
{
  "instance_pub_key" : "MAGICEUCALYPTUSINSTPUBKEYPLACEHOLDER

...

PS A:\> ls


    Directory: A:\


Mode                LastWriteTime     Length Name
----                -------------     ------ ----
-a---         2/27/2017  11:21 PM       9399 credential
-a---          3/1/2017  11:21 AM        292 configuration.xml
-a---          3/1/2017  11:21 AM         37 instinfo.xml


PS A:\> echo "hello" > hello.txt
PS A:\> cat .\hello.txt
hello
PS A:\>
{code}


From the NC:
{code:java}
[root@e-13 ~]# ps -ef | grep i-e368a863
qemu      3937     1 44 12:19 ?        00:02:50 /usr/libexec/qemu-kvm -name guest=i-e368a863,debug-threads=on -S -object secret,id=masterKey0,format=raw,file=/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/domain-40-i-e368a863/master-key.aes -machine pc-i440fx-rhel7.3.0,accel=kvm,usb=off -m 2048 -realtime mlock=off -smp 4,sockets=1,cores=4,threads=1 -uuid 88d584f6-4674-4c8f-bd91-abaa2b5b712e -nographic -no-user-config -nodefaults -chardev socket,id=charmonitor,path=/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/domain-40-i-e368a863/monitor.sock,server,nowait -mon chardev=charmonitor,id=monitor,mode=control -rtc base=localtime -no-shutdown -boot strict=on -device piix3-usb-uhci,id=usb,bus=pci.0,addr=0x1.0x2 -drive file=/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAKNXMPG2EVWAMDMHJ/i-e368a863/floppy,format=raw,if=none,id=drive-fdc0-0-0,cache=none -global isa-fdc.driveA=drive-fdc0-0-0 -drive file=/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-360000000000000000e00000000100001,format=raw,if=none,id=drive-virtio-disk0,serial=euca-bdm-ebs1-dev-vda,cache=none -device virtio-blk-pci,scsi=off,bus=pci.0,addr=0x3,drive=drive-virtio-disk0,id=virtio-disk0,bootindex=1 -netdev tap,fd=28,id=hostnet0,vhost=on,vhostfd=30 -device virtio-net-pci,netdev=hostnet0,id=net0,mac=d0:0d:e3:68:a8:63,bus=pci.0,addr=0x2 -add-fd set=2,fd=32 -chardev file,id=charserial0,path=/dev/fdset/2,append=on -device isa-serial,chardev=charserial0,id=serial0 -device virtio-balloon-pci,id=balloon0,bus=pci.0,addr=0x4 -msg timestamp=on
root      5733  5631  0 12:26 pts/0    00:00:00 grep --color=auto i-e368a863
[root@e-13 ~]# mkdir blah
[root@e-13 ~]# mount -t auto /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDAAKNXMPG2EVWAMDMHJ/i-e368a863/floppy blah
[root@e-13 ~]# ls -l blah
total 11
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 root root  292 Mar  1 03:21 configuration.xml
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 root root 9399 Feb 27 15:21 credential
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 root root   16 Mar  1 03:25 hello.txt
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 root root   37 Mar  1 03:21 instinfo.xml
[root@e-13 ~]# cat blah/hello.txt 
��hello
[root@e-13 ~]# cat blah/configuration.xml 
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<Configuration xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" version="0.1" xmlns="http://eucalyptus.com">
  <Hostname>i-e368a863</Hostname>
  <LocalAccount />
  <ActiveDirectory xsi:nil="true" />
</Configuration>[root@e-13 ~]# umount blah

{code}

Next I will verify ELB testing with ssl termination succeeds as per [~spark] recommended.

Testing is complete on the ELB question, and verified by Sang-Min.


{code:java}
[root@d-11 ~]# euform-describe-stack-resources -n cfn-stack-1
RESOURCE InstanceSecurityGroup cfn-stack-1-InstanceSecurityGroup-XANQGIBLKYXFH AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup CREATE_COMPLETE
RESOURCE Ec2Instance1 i-d20058c5 AWS::EC2::Instance CREATE_COMPLETE
RESOURCE ElasticLoadBalancer cfn-stac-ElasticLo-5JOP2IG5C5XU3 AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancerCREATE_COMPLETE
RESOURCE Ec2Instance2 i-26e4ed5b AWS::EC2::Instance CREATE_COMPLETE
[root@d-11 ~]# euform-describe-stacks
STACK cfn-stack-1 CREATE_COMPLETE Based on the AWS Cloudformation Sample Template for ELB.  Modify this template, and put the correct emi-XXXX in the value fields with a blank key of the AWSRegionArch2AMI mapping. 2017-03-02T15:30:48.187Z
PARAMETER InstanceType m1.medium
PARAMETER WebServerPort 80
PARAMETER KeyName bacchi
PARAMETER SSHLocation 0.0.0.0/0
PARAMETER ServerCertArn arn:aws:iam::000506118933:server-certificate/devops-admin-new
OUTPUT URL http://cfn-stac-ElasticLo-5JOP2IG5C5XU3-000506118933.lb.d-13.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@d-11 ~]# curl -I -k https://cfn-stac-ElasticLo-5JOP2IG5C5XU3-000506118933.lb.d-13.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 02 Mar 2017 16:16:14 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.6 (CentOS) PHP/5.4.16
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.4.16
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
{code}

CFN template used to build this environment is being attached for reference.

This is now ready for inclusion in 4.4, changes have been merged as of this morning.

Verified.
